sentence.Network_en: Recline & Sprawl is an amusingly named furniture shop in London.
sentence.Network_cn: Recline&Sprawl是伦敦一家店名有趣的家具店。

sentence.Network_en: She proceeded to recline on a chaise longue.

sentence.Network_en: Air France first-class seats recline almost like beds.
sentence.Network_cn: 法国航空公司头等舱的坐椅可以调低成几乎像床一样。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'cause to lean back'): from Old French recliner or Latin reclinare 'bend back, recline', from re- 'back' + clinare 'to bend'

entry.def: If you recline on something, you sit or lie on it with the upper part of your body supported at an angle.

example.ex: She proceeded to recline on a chaise longue...
example.tran: 她接着躺在了一个躺椅上。

example.ex: Move to a reclining position on the mattress and rest for 15 minutes.

entry.tran: 向后倾斜（坐椅）；(使)（坐椅）椅背后仰
entry.def: When a seat reclines or when you recline it, you lower the back so that it is more comfortable to sit in.

example.ex: Air France first-class seats recline almost like beds...
example.tran: 法国航空公司头等舱的坐椅可以调低成几乎像床一样。

example.ex: Ramesh had reclined his seat and was lying back smoking...
example.tran: 拉梅什把椅背调低，倚在上面吸烟。

means.word_mean: 1. move the upper body backwards and down

sentences.sentence: "She reclined her head on the pillow"

means.word_mean: 3. lean in a comfortable resting position;

auth_sentence.content: The chair has a low seat which is permanently fixed at a recline.
auth_sentence.res_content: The chair has a low seat which is permanently fixed at a recline.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The chair has a low seat which is permanently fixed at a recline.

auth_sentence.content: Republicans could easily recline and leave Mr. Obama and the Democrats to self-destruct.
auth_sentence.res_content: Republicans could easily recline and leave Mr. Obama and the Democrats to self-destruct.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Republicans could easily recline and leave Mr. Obama and the Democrats to self-destruct.

auth_sentence.content: During her four-hour court hearing in December, Ni was forced to use an oxygen tank and recline on a bed because of poor health.
auth_sentence.res_content: During her four-hour court hearing in December, Ni was forced to use an oxygen tank and recline on a bed because of poor health.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: During her four-hour court hearing in December, Ni was forced to use an oxygen tank and recline on a bed because of poor health.

stems_affixes.word_buile: dis不+inclined[[adj.倾向于,赞成的]]不兜摹鷄dj.不愿意的
incline[v.倾斜;偏向]+ed……的→adj.倾向于,赞成的
clin床+ic医学有关→n.门诊部, 临床
decline[v.倾斜;衰退]+ation表名词→n.衰退;下倾
in进入+clin倾斜,斜坡+e→进入斜→偏向,喜爱

sentences.en: She sat there, reclined against a foam rubber cushion.
sentences.cn: 她在那儿倚靠着海绵橡胶垫坐着。
